title: Aural set, choral folk song - harmonic rhythm

content.description: You will hear a folk song consisting of a brief introduction, three verses, and a codetta. The introduction and first verse will be played twice; then the entire song will be played twice. Before hearing the introduction and first verse for the first time, please read the questions.
content.question: The harmonic rhythm of the introduction could be notated as which of the following?

choices.label: Option A has four measures. No time signature is given. The rhythm of measure 1 in option A is: dotted half. The rhythm of measure 2 is: quarter, quarter, quarter. The rhythm in measure 3 dotted half. The rhythm in measure 4 is: three quarters.

Option B has four measures. No time signature is given. The rhythm in measure 1 of option B is: dotted half. The rhythm of measure 2 of option B is: quarter, dotted quarter, and eighth. The rhythm of measure 3 is: dotted half. The rhythm of measure 4 is: quarter, dotted quarter, and eighth.

Option C has four measures. No time signature is given. The rhythm of measure 1 of option C is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 2 is: quarter, half, and quarter. The rhythm of measure 3 of option C is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 4 is: quarter, half, quarter.

Option D has four measures. No time signature is given.The rhythm of measure 1 of option D is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 2 is: dotted quarter, dotted quarter, quarter. The rhythm of measure 3 is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 4 is: dotted quarter, dotted quarter, and quarter.

content.answer: Option D has four measures. No time signature is given.The rhythm of measure 1 of option D is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 2 is: dotted quarter, dotted quarter, quarter. The rhythm of measure 3 is: whole note. The rhythm of measure 4 is: dotted quarter, dotted quarter, and quarter.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

topic.text: 4.3: Harmonic Progression, Functional Harmony, and Cadences

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
